What's On Tap

We believe that each style of beer has its nuances in the brewing process. For example a Lager must be aged cold, a Saison fermented warm, and hoppy beers must be drank fresh.

At High Branch we create beers that we like to drink, aggressively hopped ales and Belgian inspired ales (with a few sour beers thrown in). We don't do this because we have huge egos, itâ€™s just that we think focusing on a limited number of styles allows us to hone in our processes and stay true to ourselves and our customers.

Events

About Us

High Branch Brewing is a family-run artisanal brewery located in the historic Gibson Mill in Concord, North Carolina. We focus on Belgian inspired and hop forward ales, with an emphasis on fermentation profiles.

Our Story

To us, High Branch symbolizes always reaching for the "higher branch" and endeavoring to improve our product.

We wanted to create a brewery/taproom space that is fun and lighthearted, while keeping the quality of our beer as the top priority.

High Branch strives to use local ingredients and develop relationships with farmers and other small businesses.

We canâ€™t thank our family and friends enough as theyâ€™ve helped to make the dream of sharing our craft with the community a reality.

— TJ & Maureen

The Taproom

High Branch is located in the Gibson Mill. As you enter the parking lot, our front entrance is through the double doors under the green awning. We are in Suite 148 at the end of the hall. You can also use the rear entrance which is just behind the main building and to the left.

Our taproom is a family friendly space to relax, socialize and enjoy great beer. We have indoor and outdoor seating, and dogs are welcome on our deck.

We try to offer food on Saturdays through a food truck or special event. Our guests are also always welcome to bring food in, or have it delivered to the taproom.

High Branch has live music 2-3 nights a month, as well as other collaborations with local businesses. Please check our Facebook page for a list of upcoming events!

Big Sister

American Double IPA

This beer is our interpretation of a Double IPA, itâ€™s loaded with hops and fits within the ABV range for a standard example. The IBUs are there but the bitterness is subdued and thanks to a touch of oats in the recipe it drinks incredibly smooth.

  • ABV: 8%
  • Availability: Keg
